name: Imipramine (Tofranil)
summary: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used for depression, anxiety, and certain childhood enuresis cases.
description: Imipramine is a tricyclic antidepressant that inhibits the reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin, increasing their levels in the brain. It is indicated for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, and as a second-line treatment for nocturnal enuresis in children. Due to its anticholinergic and cardiotoxic potential, monitoring is essential, especially in older adults.

contraindications: Concurrent use of MAOIs or within 14 days
Known hypersensitivity to imipramine or other TCAs

sections.text: Inhibits norepinephrine and serotonin reuptake; also has anticholinergic, antihistaminic, and alpha-adrenergic blocking activity.

adult.depression_anxiety: 75–150 mg/day in divided doses or once nightly; may increase up to 200–300 mg/day for severe cases

sections.text: Antidepressant effects typically observed within 2–4 weeks; enuresis effects may occur within a few days.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Cardiotoxic in overdose; prescribe smallest effective quantity

items: ECG in older adults or those with cardiac history

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; potential fetal effects
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; may cause sedation in infant
sections.pediatrics: Approved for enuresis in children ≥6 years
sections.geriatrics: Greater sensitivity to anticholinergic and cardiac effects

sections.text: Reduce gradually over several weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, headache, and malaise.

items: Commonly replaced by SSRIs for depression due to side effect profile
Still useful in treatment-resistant depression and enuresis
High risk of lethality in overdose—monitor closely
